bookmania 157287902777 "2017-02-15 21:46:24 GMT" http://bookmania.me/post/157287902777/this-is-how-to-break-your-heart "No heart would ever break
column4: Nothing ever exists that will never last
column6: and shivering happiness  That burns my skin and bares never ending light
column7: this crying that comes from joy– Is my song. Your tears will tickle out
column8: as a form of an overflowing gratitude to your past
column9: but there will be a torture inside your tummy: A torment of sweetness and fragrance; because it will embrace your nothingness
column10: and nonetheless explore your darkness. If this one breaks
column11: It will only make you laugh
column12: because My pulse is your drinking glass
column13: and my absence is your obsession. And if ever my heart gets inflamed
column14: It will be burned with all of your smiles that I love– The wrinkles that they leave. This is how to surrender love
column16: for hope. This is how to try
column17: because  certainly you could get those tiny moments of sadness
column18: but just in case that you need it
column19: break it! So that you aren’t only safe

column1: bookmania 155024688297 "2016-12-27 15:05:28 GMT" http://bookmania.me/post/155024688297/read-catfishing-strangers-to-find-myself-by "Catfishing Strangers to Find Myself by Kalle Oskari MattilaThis is an excerpt of a memoir written by my friend from The New York Times: the most interesting and probably the most honest article I have read and re-read this 2016. It’s beautiful
column2: especially if you are into exploring your own self and identity. ________Reading starts below: “More than a decade ago
column3: when I was growing up in Finland
column4: my model of an attractive woman was Pamela Anderson from “Baywatch.” She was my father’s favorite. Whenever the boys at school asked me who I Googled when my parents weren’t home
column7: ” and the name was greeted with a unanimous nodding of heads….”Read more" True text

column1: bookmania 152689258865 "2016-11-03 16:15:30 GMT" http://bookmania.me/post/152689258865/the-majestic-boekhandel-selexyz-dominicanen-in "The Boekhandel Selexyz Dominicanen is a bookshop which was once a Dominican church. Years ago
column2: the church was still a place for people to park bicycles in Maastricht
column3: Netherlands. Architectural firm Merkx+Girod designed the church by altering the interiors a little by adding modern elements and keeping the original architectural style. Successfully opened on Christmas day of the year 2006
column4: Selexyz offers a wide range of popular books and books for professionals. (photo by Ana Compadre)  " True text

column1: bookmania 148167124097 "2016-07-29 22:08:25 GMT" http://bookmania.me/post/148167124097/a-1942-army-educational-mobile-library-in-brisbane "This is an Australian Army Educational Mobile Library stopping by in Eagle Street
column3: a soldier goes inside a mini library at the rear of the truck to browse the shelves. The truck parks outside a commercial building to advertise the chain of mini libraries roaming around the town.This marks Australia’s commitment to education
column5: reminding everyone the importance of knowledge and how it can mould the shape of a nation.  (Photo from John Oxley Library
column6: State Library of Queensland)" True text

column1: bookmania 147606395014 "2016-07-18 19:40:20 GMT" http://bookmania.me/post/147606395014/book-stack-fahrenheit-451-by-ray-bradbury "  “If you hide your ignorance
column2: no one will hit you and you’ll never learn.” ― Ray Bradbury
column3: Fahrenheit 451     Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury  is a classic dystopian novel of a post-literate future
column4: which stands alongside Orwell’s 1984 and Huxley’s Brave New World as a prophetic account of Western civilization’s enslavement by the media
column5: drugs and conformity.Bradbury’s powerful and poetic prose combines with uncanny insight into the potential of technology to create a novel which
column7: still has the power to dazzle and shock." True text

column1: bookmania 147256790207 "2016-07-11 21:52:35 GMT" http://bookmania.me/post/147256790207/loving-the-same-book "  “There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books.”  This is just speculation
column2: but there’s a truthfulness in these words. What if you actually encounter one person in your life and that person literally have read and loved what you have read? It must be real heaven
column3: a truly wonderful event in one’s life.This alone qualifies the beginning of firm connections between and among exploring beings. " True text

bookmania 4541401719 "2011-04-12 01:32:00 GMT" http://bookmania.me/post/4541401719/modern-librarys-100-best-novels "The Modern Library has played a significant role in American cultural life for the better part of a century. For decades
column2: young Americans cut their intellectual teeth on Modern Library books. The series shaped their tastes
column4: provided them with a window on the world. Many of the country’s celebrated writers are quick to attest that they “grew up with the Modern Library.” (read more)" True link
